item.title: Dymock probate inventories, 1613-1796
item.description: This long run of 76 inventories from Dymock was transcribed in 2013 by volunteers at Gloucestershire Archives, and complements the published coverage of Dymock in VCH Gloucestershire Vol 12.  Where occupations are stated, yeomen, husbandmen and labourers predominate, but also present are a cordwainer, tailor, and blacksmith. There are two 'gentlemen':  John Hankin, and the memorably-named Younger Hooper the elder.
item.dc:creator: JamesH
